Node.definition: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
= action by which humans share a meal with other humans
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
= small blade with a handle, ► used for cutting
= the front part of the neck
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= person engaged in a certain activity

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= state in which humans sense a physical craving for food or alcoholic drinks; this desire is associated with one's נֶפֶשׁ (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil
= food of a high quality and with a delicious taste
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
literally: falsehood; hence: = things that cannot be trusted

Node.gloss: to grow weary|to wear oneself out|to labor|to toil
Node.definition: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= causative action by which humans desist from performing an event that has not yet started
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
literally: (one's) eye flies (on something); hence: = process by which humans perceive with their eyes

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: to make (possessions); hence: = action by which humans obtain possessions
literally: to make (possessions); hence: = action by which humans obtain possessions
= part of body; ◄ of bird, insect, celestial creature; ► used for flying but also to give protection

exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of large birds of prey with keen eyesight; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ associated with large size and great strength, ability to fly great distances at high speed; symbol of protection, metaphor for God, but also symbol for death in battle
= action by which a winged living creature moves through the air by flapping its wings

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
= action by which humans ingest food

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= state in which humans sense a physical craving for food or alcoholic drinks; this desire is associated with one's נֶפֶשׁ (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil
= food of a high quality and with a delicious taste

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= a relatively small quantity of food
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= action by which humans or animals vomit up something specific from their stomachs
= conditions and circumstances that have qualities that inspire appreciation
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

= state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's heart (לֵב) the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

= a piece of land outside of inhabited areas, which is the property of individuals, generally used for cultivating food trees, grain, and vegetables; can be bought and sold; property which can be transferred from one person to another

= person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor

= causative action by which humans or deity deliver an individual or group of people from the power of someone else or from difficult circumstances, ► which usually implies that the one who performed the act of deliverance has the right to claim the ones he delivered for himself
= state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to plead (another's cause)|to defend|to take up (another's) cause
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities resolve a conflict for their own benefit or for the benefit of (other) humans who may not be in a position to do that for themselves

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: dispute, quarrel, strife, argument|(law)suit, case, indictment
Node.definition: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to be able|to be skillful|to be wise|to be intelligent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse
literally: kidney; hence: = seat of a person's emotions and devotion to God, created by God, and hidden to everyone but God himself

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: smoothness; hence: = state in which an event is morally and ethically right

Node.gloss: to envy|to be envious|to be jealous of (someone else)
Node.definition: = process by which humans experience a sentiment of anger with regard to someone else, ◄ because that other person has qualities, privileges, or possessions that one feels one should have as well, or because that person lavishes favors on another party that one feels should be directed to oneself
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= pattern of actions by which humans commit specified or implied offenses, ► resulting in a state of guilt which may require atonement, restitution, and retribution
= set of particles marking an object or event as opposed to other objects and events
= state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: all the day; hence: = process by which an event or pattern of events takes place for an extended time, without interruption
= particle marking an oath or a similar strongly worded statement
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
literally: to cut off (an event); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to stop happening
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child

Node.gloss: to be able|to be skillful|to be wise|to be intelligent
Node.definition: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

Node.gloss: to guide (one's heart) along the (right) road > to think right
Node.definition: = literally: to cause one's heart to follow the (right) road; hence: = to think morally and ethically correctly
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

Node.gloss: to drink in excess|to be a drunkard
Node.definition: = action by which humans consume alcoholic beverages in large quantities, ► which results in drunkenness and other forms of loose behavior, ≈ and is generally regarded as foolish and unacceptable

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex
= state in which humans have the habit of ingesting more food than enough or appropriate; ≈ regarded as despicable and shameful behavior
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

Node.gloss: to drink in excess|to be a drunkard
Node.definition: = action by which humans consume alcoholic beverages in large quantities, ► which results in drunkenness and other forms of loose behavior, ≈ and is generally regarded as foolish and unacceptable
= state in which humans have the habit of ingesting more food than enough or appropriate; ≈ regarded as despicable and shameful behavior
= process by which humans lose their possessions and become poor
= tattered clothes; ≈ associated with poverty
= causative action by which humans help other humans to put on clothes
= state in which humans or animals are in a state of a relatively light sleep; ≈ sometimes with being inactive
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= process by which males among humans and animals generate offspring
= state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions
= state in which humans are advanced in age, ≈ and the body is no longer able to function as before
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
= state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

Node.gloss: to acquire|to obtain|to purchase|to buy|to reclaim
Node.definition: = action by which humans acquire an animate or inanimate object ◄ by means of a financial transaction or in another way|literally: to acquire; hence: = action by which humans acquire a certain quality
literally: to sell (a quality); hence: = action by which humans part with a certain quality
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= process by which males among humans and animals generate offspring
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort
= direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time
= hole in the ground; ◄ either natural or dug by humans; ► can be used to trap animals; ≈ associated with danger
= woman that sells her body for payment, making of this her profession; ≈ often associated with shame and sinful behavior

= naturally occurring depression, hole or pit, usually containing a substance in liquid form; ≈ a metaphor for death, based on the physical resemblance of a pit to a grave, on the danger of falling into a pit, or being drowned by water in it, and on the depth of a pit recalling the underworld place of the dead
= state in which an object is relatively small in size, ≈ with the connotation of being too small to be able to do what it is intended for, and with trouble
literally: foreign woman; = a woman who is the wife of someone else

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= someone who takes away someone else's possessions against that person's will

Node.gloss: to lie in wait|to lay an ambush|to lurk
Node.definition: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
exclamation expressing grief and dismay

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
exclamation expressing grief and dismay

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by accident or aggression; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to refer to difficult circumstances
= action by which someone performs an event without any argument, cause, or reason that could possibly explain or justify it

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= condition of eyeball tinged with blood; ◄ usually the result of drinking much wine; ≈ not necessarily seen as something bad

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

Node.gloss: to delay|to linger|to stay|to be slow
Node.definition: = to do something later than expected

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex

Node.gloss: to look for|to try out|to test|to search out|to explore|to investigate|to examine|to cross examine|to sound out|to determine
Node.definition: = action by which someone tries to obtain information about a certain object, person, or event by examining it carefully
= wine (יַיִן) mixed with water or spices; ► used as beverage, but also as sacrifice

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex
= state in which an object is red or reddish in color; ≈ often associated with beauty
= small, bowl shaped container ► used for drinking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote one's portion in life, received from God
literally: the eye (of an object); hence: = the part of an object that can be seen with the eye
= process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another
= state in which an object has a relativedly flat surface, where people and objects can move without obstacles; ≈ associated with security and propsperity
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion

= long legless reptile without eyelids or external ears; it moves by wriggling or gliding; some species have a poisonous bite; ≈ symbol of lurking, unexpected danger; associated with lies, deception, and misleading teaching
= action by which a person or animal uses teeth to cut into something, like another person or animal

= extremely poisonous snake with the ability to spread the ribs in the neck area so as to form a broad, flat profile; dark brown in color with a yellowish underside (and sometimes yellowish bands); ◄ Desert Cobra (|iWalterinnesia aegyptia|i*) or Egyptian Cobra (|iNaja haje|i*); ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with aggression and lurking danger
= action by which animals produce a poisonous liquid

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which an object is considered as not belonging to a certain group of objects
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security
literally: heart; hence: = the location right in the middle of something else, such as the sea, the heavens, or a tree
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security
literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed
= long wooden pole; ◄ part of a ship; ► functions as support of sail(s)
= particle marking a proposition as not true

Node.gloss: to be, become weak|to be, become powerless|to be sick|to be injured
Node.definition: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances
= action by which humans or animals deliver a blow to an object with their hands, whether or not with the help of an instrument such as a hammer (הַלְמוּת) or with their feet
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive
= process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died
= process by which an action is repeated or continued
= action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another
